abstract: OZ Africa Management, unit of hedge fund Och-Ziff Capital Management, is expected to enter guilty plea to bribery charges; Och-Ziff is also expected to enter into deferred-prosecution agreement and pay fine of around $400 million following end of multiyear investigation.
lead_paragraph: Daniel Och, founder of the $39 billion hedge fund, is also expected to be named in an S.E.C. complaint and enter an agreement over inaccurate record-keeping, according to people briefed on the matter.
snippet: Daniel Och, founder of the $39 billion hedge fund, is also expected to be named in an S.E.C. complaint and enter an agreement over inaccurate record-keeping, according to people briefed on the matter....

headline.main: Och-Ziff African Unit Expected to Plead Guilty to Bribery
headline.print_headline: African Unit of Och-Ziff Said Near Bribe Plea
